title: Avocado Hollandaise Eggs Benedict
subtitle: This classic brunch favorite is given a little spin to make it a bit healthier and lighter.
subtitle2: Every single time I go to brunch, I always get the eggs benedict. I love the creamy hollandaise enveloping the poached eggs on 2 pieces of warm english muffins. This recipe takes all of those components and makes it a bit healthier. The avocado hollandaise is vegan and much lighter than the traditional yolk based hollandaise.
steps: For the Hollandaise, add lemon juice, avocado, water, salt, pepper, chili powder, and garlic powder to a high powered blender (Vitamix).
Start the machine and increase to highest speed. Blend for 30 seconds.
Reduce the speed. Remove the lid plug and slowly drizzle oil through the lid plug opening.
Close the lid plug, and increase to highest speed. Blend for 15 seconds or until desired consistency is reached. Taste and adjust seasonings as needed
For the veggies, cut the cherry tomatoes into halves and toss with !oil-tomato. Place on baking tray with parchment paper. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until tomatoes are crispy and bursting.
Saute the spinach with the remaining !oil-spinach in a pan. Cook until spinach is completely wilted and most of the water has evaporated.
For the eggs, in a large pan (at least 4 inch walls) fill it ¾ full of water. Place on heat and bring to a simmer
To create perfect poached eggs, crack the egg into a strainer. Let some of the thinner egg whites drain off. Place the egg that is in the strainer into a small bowl. Repeat for each egg.
Slowly lower each egg into the water, keep them at least 1 inch apart. In my 14 inch pan I can normally fit 5 eggs.
Cook for 2 minutes. Use a spider strainer and remove each egg. Repeat until all eggs are poached.

For plating, divide the spinach and tomatoes evenly among the pieces of toast. Top each with 2 eggs. Drizzle on the avocado hollandaise. Top with seasoning of choice (chili flakes or everything bagel seasoning). This dish pairs well with hash browns (I did sweet potato hash browns).
